page.title: 01The Chiltern Escarpment Oxon
page.content: The most striking feature of this block is the scarp slope and the M40 cutting through it. On either side is the Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve for research into effects of management on chalk grassland,its botany and invertibrtes. Areas of scrub and woodland attract good breeding populatins of resident and migrant birds, winter migrants are attracted by wild fruits and passage migrants are often recorded. Beacon Hill still has a beacon on it, the post office telecommunications tower. The A40 London to Oxford road carries local traffic up though the beechwoods a few dwellings along side it. An earlier route, several prehistoric sunken ways and the Icknieldway (alon the foot of the hills) are now public footpaths.
